p: Research from New South Wales (Australia) found a statistically significant relationship between drought and suicide from 1964 to 2001 [ 227]. Limited studies suggest that drought is a contributing factor to suicide among men in rural areas in Australia [ 228, 229]. However, Page and Fragar [ 230] found a greater rate of suicide between 1988 and 1997 among male farm managers and agricultural labourers than among the male Australian population or the rural population overall, independent of drought.
